snippet: The guidelines reflect concerns about the misuse of sites like Facebook and Twitter and represent the latest official response to allegations of teachers behaving inappropriately with students.
abstract: New York City Education Dept releases its first guidelines governing the use of social media by employees, advising teachers to maintain separate professional and personal Web pages; teachers may not contact students through personal Web pages, but can communicate via pages set up for classroom use; dozens of city teachers have been investigated in recent years for inappropriate interactions with students that began on social media sites.

byline.original: By DAVID W. CHEN and PATRICK McGEEHAN

lead_paragraph: The guidelines reflect concerns about the misuse of sites like Facebook and Twitter and represent the latest official response to allegations of teachers behaving inappropriately with students.

headline.seo: Social Media Rules Limit Student-Teacher Contact
headline.main: Social Media Rules Limit New York Student-Teacher Contact
